page.title: 05POLICE STATION/FIRE STATION
page.content: Collier Row Police Station was built in 1934. It is situated in Collier Row Lane and is central to shops and schools, etc. The building was intended as a public house!! There are some women police officers at the station. Women police constables were first employed in 1914, when the men went off to war. Policemen buy their own boots, but not their own uniform. Romford Fire Station is in Pettits Lane North. 54 men work there in four watches. They are called out to a fire, on average, 35 times a week. The drill tower is 21 metres high. A fire-engine is usually 6 metres long and costs Â£55,000 without extras - it's top speed is 70 miles per hour. Each station is equipped with a multi-gym, where the firemen keep fit.
